.

Triunfo is a green oasis in the otherwise arid Sertao region in Northeastern Brazil.  Situated between mountains and at a lakefront, the city has a cool climate.  Maximum temperature is 28ºC in the summer and 5ºC in winter evenings.

(Student Festival), the city's main annual festivity.

Local specialties include Bode (goat meat), Carne de Sol, Galinha de Cabidela, Alfenim de Rapadura, Angu Salgado and Licor de Rosas.

Triunfo is also famous for Rapadura, a traditional sugar candy.
